entry.body: load name = set the named configuration for the current file load name file = set the named configuration, set the configuration file load -list = list all configurationnames in current configuration file. load -list file = list all of the configuration names in the given file.

Invocation option for the configuration file. This requires the full path to the configuration file. You can also use the long version of -configFile.
E.g. java -jar cli.jar -cfg /path/to/cfg.xml -name default
would load the configuration file, cfg.xml, find the configuration named "default" and set that as the current configuration.
Note that if the named configuration or file cannot be found, a message is printed and the system loads with no configuration.
See also: -name, invocation, load

Invocation option for the name of a configuration. A configuration file must be loaded as well or you will get an error. There is a long version of this switch, -configName too.
See also: -cfg, invocation, load
